senses.sense_definition: Likely to succeed or be effective in a real situation; suitable for a particular purpose.

examples.text: We need to find a <w>practical</w> solution to this problem quickly.
High heels are not very <w>practical</w> for walking on the beach.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to real situations, actions, and experience rather than ideas or imagination.

examples.text: The candidate has extensive <w>practical</w> experience in project management.
This book offers a guide to the <w>practical</w> application of the theory.

senses.sense_definition: Of a person: able to make sensible decisions and deal with everyday problems effectively.

examples.text: She is a very <w>practical</w> woman who can fix almost anything in the house.
Let's be <w>practical</w> and admit that we cannot finish the work today.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to props or lighting in film and theater that function realistically rather than being simulated.

examples.text: The director preferred using <w>practical</w> lighting to make the scene look more authentic.
They built a <w>practical</w> door that the actors could actually open and close.

senses.sense_definition: An examination or lesson, especially in science, where students do experiments or tasks rather than writing.

examples.text: I passed the written exam but I am worried about the chemistry <w>practical</w>.
Students must attend every laboratory <w>practical</w> to complete the course.

senses.sense_definition: A real light fixture or functional prop visible on a film set, as opposed to studio lighting or fake objects.

examples.text: The cinematographer asked to dim the <w>practical</w> on the bedside table.
We need to wire the <w>practicals</w> so they can be controlled from the lighting board.
